greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n^3 + n.
comment: k such that x^3 + x + k factors over the integers. - _James R. Buddenhagen_, Apr 19 2005
After 0, sum of next n even numbers:
Sequence occurs in the binomial identity Sum_{k = 0..n} a(k)* binomial(n,k)/binomial(n+k,k) = n*(n + 1)/2. Cf. A092181 and A155977. - _Peter Bala_, Feb 12 2019
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: For n>1, a(n) = floor(n^5/(n^2-1)). - _Gary Detlefs_, Feb 10 2010
Sum_{n>=1} 1/a(n) = 0.6718659855... = gamma + Re psi(1+i) = A001620+A248117. [Borwein et al., J. Math. Anal. Appl. 316 (2006) 328]. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 17 2012
a(n) = -a(-n) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 11 2017
mathematica: Table[n^3 + n, {n, 0, 40}] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Mar 06 2010 *)
program: a034262 n = a000578 n + n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 26 2014
results.author: Stuart M. Ellerstein (ellerstein(AT)aol.com), Apr 21 2000
